alert.note: Alert for Russell (Kansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued June 09 at 8:44PM CDT until June 09 at 9:30PM CDT by NWS Wichita
info.description: ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 945 AM CDT SATURDAY... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...A portion of Central Kansas, including the following counties, Barton and Russell. * WHEN...Until 945 AM CDT Saturday. * IMPACTS...Flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations is imminent or occurring. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 844 PM CDT, Local law enforcement reported standing water on a few rural roads in far southern Russell county due to earlier heavy rainfall. Minor flooding is ongoing and expected to continue. Radar estimated between 3 and 5 inches of rain had fallen over the warned area. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Susank.
info.instruction: Do not drive into flooded areas or go around barricades. Nearly two feet of water will carry most vehicles away. Turn around, don`t drown.
